snippet: The trustees’ vote comes amid a movement to have universities cease inquiring about criminal histories when students apply, a practice many say disproportionately hurts blacks....
abstract: Board of trustees for State University of New York votes to remove question about prior felony convictions from undergraduate application; move addresses concerns that such questions disproportionately affect blacks.
lead_paragraph: The trustees’ vote comes amid a movement to have universities cease inquiring about criminal histories when students apply, a practice many say disproportionately hurts blacks.

headline.main: SUNY to Stop Asking Applicants About Felony Convictions
headline.print_headline: SUNY Application to Excise Felony Question
